modules.description: This module implements file storage operations using MariaDB, providing functions to upload, download, update, and delete files represented as base64-encoded data. It works with file metadata and content through `Sihl__.Contract_storage.file` and `Sihl__.Contract_storage.stored` types, handling large object storage in a relational database. Concrete use cases include storing user-uploaded files, retrieving file content for display or processing, and managing file metadata with optional context-based filtering.

This module implements file storage operations including uploading, downloading, updating, and deleting files using base64 encoding. It works with stored file metadata and raw base64 string content, interacting with a repository for data persistence. Concrete use cases include handling file uploads from base64-encoded payloads, retrieving stored file data, and managing file metadata lifecycle.

This module manages file metadata and storage operations, providing concrete types for files and stored data with support for modifying properties like mime type, size, and filename. It enables use cases such as handling uploaded files with associated binary data, serializing file information, and managing storage in relational databases via MariaDB or generic base64-encoded representations. The MariaDB submodule supports uploading, downloading, and managing files as large objects, while the base64 submodule handles file storage with raw base64 content and metadata lifecycle operations.
